objects.name: uses exploits from a commercial rooting app to gain root privilege
Abuses the Android Accessibility Service feature to steal sensitive messages from popular communication and social apps
Takes advantage of the commercial rooting app “Baidu Easy Root” to gain root privilege
maintain persistence on the compromised device
Harvests an exhaustive list of personal information including phone number, IMEI, IMSI, SMS, MMS, contacts, accounts, phone call history, location, and connected Wi-Fi information
Automatically answer incoming phone calls from a specific number
Remote control of the device via UDP, TCP and SMS channels
Recording the phone call and the surrounding audio & video
Taking photos via both the front and rear camera
registers two broadcast receivers to listen for events related to the device booting up and network connection status
retrieves configuration information from the local asset file
List files under a given directory
Do not intercept incoming SMS messages
maintain persistence on the compromised device
receiving commands from remote servers via a number of different channels
egisters a broadcast receiver with a higher priority than the default messaging app to listen for the commands via incoming SMS messages
Get geographical location via GSM cell information
Collect the contacts on the device and send back via SMS
Gather SMS messages which are created later than a given date in the inbox, outbox and draft box, and then send back via SMS
Exfiltrate call histories that are later than a given date through SMS
Set the auto reply phone number
automatically answer the incoming phone call when the number is the same as the set one
compromised device’s location is exposed to the attacker
set the remote server’s IP address
creates a TCP server on the compromised device listening at port 39568 and waits for incoming commands
Send back device information including IMEI, IMSI and phone number
Send back contacts information including contact name and phone number
Send back SMS messages in inbox, outbox and draft box
Send back call histories including phone call duration, type and date
Send back the information of files under a given directory
actively connect to the remote server with the configured IP address to ask for commands through UDP or TCP
inserts an SMS message into the inbox
posts a notification indicating an SMS message has arrived
data sent back to the remote server is encrypted using TEA algorithm
creates an effective session layer on top of UDP
divides the original data into multiple groups and each group has no more than 1000 bytes data
employ many mechanisms to collect private data
tries to gather data from more than 40 common apps falling in different categories including social, communication, browser, mobile mail client, etc
abuse the “Root Assistant” tool to gain root access
exfiltrates private data from more than 40 apps
steals sensitive messages from communication apps
abusing the Android accessibility service feature
